edu.rit.crypto

Interface StreamCipher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RC4

    public interface StreamCipher
    Interface StreamCipher specifies the interface for a stream cipher.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int encrypt(int b)
      Encrypt or decrypt the given byte.
      int keySize()
      Returns this stream cipher's key size in bytes.
      void setKey(byte[] key)
      Set the key for this stream cipher.

    • Method Detail

      • keySize

        int keySize()
        Returns this stream cipher's key size in bytes. If the stream cipher includes both a key and a nonce, keySize() returns the size of the key plus the nonce in bytes.
        Returns:
        Key size.

      • setKey

        void setKey(byte[] key)
        Set the key for this stream cipher. key must be an array of bytes whose length is equal to keySize(). If the stream cipher includes both a key and a nonce, key contains the bytes of the key followed by the bytes of the nonce. The keystream generator is initialized, such that successive calls to encrypt() will encrypt or decrypt a series of bytes.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key.length ≠ keySize().

      • encrypt

        int encrypt(int b)
        Encrypt or decrypt the given byte. Only the least significant 8 bits of b are used. If b is a plaintext byte, the ciphertext byte is returned as a value from 0 to 255. If b is a ciphertext byte, the plaintext byte is returned as a value from 0 to 255.
        Parameters:
        b - Plaintext byte (if encrypting), ciphertext byte (if decrypting).
        Returns:
        Ciphertext byte (if encrypting), plaintext byte (if decrypting).
